body_html:
Looks good. So this implementation assumes that the tree is known a-priori, doesn't it?
So it maps (embeddings, tree) to (sentiment).

Would it also be able to map (embeddings) to (tree,sentiment)? because that is what the paper which OP refers to is doing
body_text:
Looks good. So this implementation assumes that the tree is known a-priori, doesn't it?
So it maps (embeddings, tree) to (sentiment).
Would it also be able to map (embeddings) to (tree,sentiment)? because that is what the paper which OP refers to is doing
body:
Looks good. So this implementation assumes that the tree is known a-priori, doesn't it?
So it maps (embeddings, tree) to (sentiment).

Would it also be able to map (embeddings) to (tree,sentiment)? because that is what [the paper which OP refers to](http://www.socher.org/index.php/Main/ParsingNaturalScenesAndNaturalLanguageWithRecursiveNeuralNetworks) is doing
